Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 06:09AM - edited Apr 27, 2011 11:15AM by Luan Hi Marion, I don't mean to press, but if i were in the same situation, I wold then be at the doorsteps of the bc clinic clinic first thing when they open. Your intuition plus the fact that u are not feeling well at all, IBC is an emergency situation. When i showed my lump to an endo 2 weeks after that stupid family doctor, she told me that if i had to crawl to the breast center to do so. Was biopsied same day and had surgery within one week. It was an ER situation. had a lot of pain, redness. My situation was dire also, had lost my job six months prior, but our health is priority no 1. Please let us know how everythimg goes.

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2011 08:28AM - edited Apr 27, 2011 08:31AM by Luan Sorry to hear Lago.  Humm.......wonder if my stupid onco did it again.  Developed a rash on my radiated breast (6 months post), really really itchy, does not hurt though.  The onco gave me a cortisone cream and said he would have to send me to a dermatologist if it did not get better.  The cream seems to be helping a little bit, still very itchy.  I'm only seeing him again in one month.  You have me wondering  Just being in a hospital setting with all of the bacteria, viruses and germs crawling around puts us at risk.  I've developed a rash on my arm after sporting a stupid gown at the BS office !  I figured this rash was from the mammogram machine which may not have been wiped before I was its next victim.... I am now scratching all over !!!

Posts.Content: May 18, 2011 08:13PM Luan wrote: Hi Justdance ! Yup, one year ago...chemo was over, was waiting for Brac results to see if i was going for the rads, finally did them in august. All doable :) Hated with a passion the neupogen shots ! Rads only made me feel a bit claustro (never liked machines much) and a little bit tired. Was given Tamox 3 weeks post chemo. as for SEs, it seems to affect my brain, i.e. memory, cognitive functions...no nausea, as i take it with dinner, so sleeping on it. A tiny bit of depression, so before i move to an anti-dep, i,m gonna up my fish oil to 2000 mg, and of course tired. endo is sending me for a sleep study, i wish he would take care of my thyroid instead... so basic stuff most sisters experience. after having gone through the process, i realize that fear of the unknown and the apprehension were probably the worst for me. during chemo, i was well controlled with meds, so overall, not so bad. i,m trying to rest as much as possible, eat right, gotta work on the exercise aspect of things though. Don,t hesitate to pm me anytime, if u wish. It will all be over before u know it then u,ll be saying to yourself "now, what?" ;))

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 08:32PM - edited Jun 13, 2011 08:34PM by Luan Helichrysum, great question I have asked before, but have not gotten many returns....so went and got that mineral stick which seems to work well enough.  There is no way in hell after having gone through the treatments that I am going to apply the pharma grade deodorants or anti-perspirants in my armpits, I don't care what the biased studies say.  Essential oils like you mention might be too strong also to put into that sensitive area where lymph nodes try to do their job as best they can.  Everything we put ON our skin gets absorbed into the bloodstream.  Just watched a documentary recently about this. Auntilisa: that confirms to me that the deodorant makes its way right into the lymph nodes, how scary !!!

Posts.Content: May 4, 2011 02:34PM Luan wrote: Hello ladies, am so glad I've found you all !! Responded to a thread lately on Lyme, CFS and BC and because I'm sooooooooooo tired and in pain, I'm just gonna copy and paste, hope you don't mind... "Have always had the lyme symptoms it seems - drs here wont test even when i insisted i had spent summers at old orchard bch when young. Was dx fibro + myofascial pain syndrome 20 years ago. Finished TAC (tough protocol) 1 year ago. cannot say i had worst SEs although asked for pain meds which most sisters do i think " "OH Boy !!  been draggin my a....for so many years, stopped counting  ....  Now, I have to wonder is fatigue related to BC (which may take up to 20 years to develop) or fibro?  Both are such complicated diseases.  Fibro here in Cnda is being treated by Rheumatologists of all people !  They give you a prescription for muscle relaxants and basically tell you not to bother them.  NO doctor likes to hear THE word. They actually equate fibro with CFS !!  Have been banging my head against the walls with this one.  Have tried to figure out whether my thyroid was the issue, was it perhaps hypoglycemia, CFS, gluten intolerance, IBS, PMS and the list goes on and on.  Call me FATIGUE ! How are you managing your fibro ?  Any tips or treatments that are working for you ?" Never got a response.... Barb, I hear you sis ...am also compounding big money problems on top of everything else and feeling most of the time that I just cannot cut it. I feel so reassured to not be sitting all alone watching the world go by without me.  God bless
